isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - CHANGING THE INPUT SHAFT - REASSEMBLY

step1.para: If necessary, install a new bushing in the pocket of the input shaft.
Install the new input shaft in the splines of the main drive gear, just far enough to expose the snap ring groove in the I.D. of the drive gear.
Install the snap ring in the groove of the drive gear.
Install the spacer on the input shaft.
Using a flanged-end driver, install the drive gear bearing on the shaft and into the case bore. When applying force to driver, use caution so as not to damage the bearing shield.

note.para: Engaging the sliding clutch into the main drive gear and blocking it forward will hold the input shaft forward.

step1.para: When drive gear bearing nut is used, degrease the threads of input shaft and use a new nut. DO NOT REUSE OLD NUT. When snap ring is used, install the snap ring in the groove of the input shaft and proceed to Step 10.
Apply Fuller Transmission adhesive sealant #71204 or equivalent to the cleaned threads on the input shaft and nut, using caution so as not to contaminate the bearing with sealant.

Engage two mainshaft sliding clutches into gear to prevent the mainshaft from rotating and install the new drive gear bearing nut, left hand threads, on the input shaft. Tighten nut to 250 to 300 ft-lbs. (339 to 407 Nm).
With a punch and maul, peen nut into the two milled slots of the input shaft, using caution so as not to distort the O.D. of the nut.
To facilitate proper re-installation of the shifter housing assembly on the case, make sure the mainshaft sliding clutches are placed in the neutral position.
Re-install the shifter housing assembly, the front bearing cover and all other parts and assemblies previously removed, making sure to replace the gaskets used.
